messages.subject: Re: Florida Homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... We live in Central Fl. and we love it! Orlando on one side, Daytona on the other, so we have lots to choose from.Bike Week just ended. Unfortunately at
messages.messageBody:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "Mark/Nancy Robbins"
<manna5@b...> wrote:
> Shele428,
>
> Your post could've been mine!
>
> Hi Nancy,
We live in Central Fl. and we love it! Orlando on one side, Daytona
on the other, so we have lots to choose from.Bike Week just ended.
Unfortunately at this time, my dh and I are w/out a bike. Hoping to
change that soon! :)
When it's warmer (80 and up lOl) we can usually be found at the
beach! :)
What part of S. Fl are you in?
Shele428

>
> >

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Florida Homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Shele428, Your post could ve been mine! We live the same way.  I lifestyle of learning, that includes a little bit of everything and anything that God so
messages.messageBody:
Shele428,

Your post could've been mine!

We live the same way. I lifestyle of learning, that includes
a little bit of everything and anything that God so brings
into our lives.

Thanks for posting. I'm in Florida too. S. Florida.

What part are you in?

Blessings,
Nancy Robbins

> We don't judge others, just love them and I never force anything on
> my kids, they see from "how" my husband and I live, and NOT from what
> we "teach".
> So if you are new to unschooling, try not to exclude yourself from
> others based on their or your religion.
> Personally, we hang out w/ lots of different types of people that
> have varying beliefs and religions. Of course living in FL helps w/
> that as it's a very diverse state.
> My 2cents
> shele428
